title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

(Exempted Development) (No. 4) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation Planning 

and Development Regulations 2001 to 2022. 

Amendment of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to Planning and Development 
Regulations 2001
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (exempted development) (no 4) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2022 amendment part 1 schedule 2 planning development regulation 2001

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 2. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Planning and Development Regulations 2001
text_raw:
2. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 
(S.I. No. 600 of 2001) is amended by inserting the following class after Class 
20E: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [605] 3 

“ 

CLASS 20F 

Temporary use by or on behalf of the 
Minister for Children, Equality, 
Disability, Integration and Youth to 
accommodate or support persons 
seeking international protection of any 
structure or part of a structure used as a 
school, college, university, training 
centre, social centre, community centre, 
non-residential club, art gallery, 
museum, library, reading room, sports 
club or stadium, gymnasium, hotel, 
convention centre, conference centre, 
shop, office, Defence Forces barracks, 
light industrial building, airport 
operational building, wholesale 
warehouse or repository, local authority 
administrative office, play centre, 
medical and other health and social care 
accommodation, event and exhibition 
space or any structure or part of 
structure normally used for public 
worship or religious instruction.
text_norm: 2 part 1 schedule 2 planning development regulation 2001 (s.i no 600 2001) amended inserting following class class 20e notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 2nd december 2022 605 3 class 20f temporary use behalf minister child equality disability integration youth accommodate support person seeking international protection structure part structure used school college university training centre social centre community centre non-residential club art gallery museum library reading room sport club stadium gymnasium hotel convention centre conference centre shop office defence force barrack light industrial building airport operational building wholesale warehouse repository local authority administrative office play centre medical health social care accommodation event exhibition space structure part structure normally used public worship religious instruction

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 1. The temporary use shall only be
text_raw:
1. The temporary use shall only be 
for the purposes of 
accommodating persons seeking 
international protection.
text_norm: 1 temporary use shall purpose accommodating person seeking international protection

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 2. The use shall be discontinued not
text_raw:
2. The use shall be discontinued not 
later than 31 December 2024.

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 3. The relevant local authority
text_raw:
3. The relevant local authority 
shall be notified of locations 
where change of use is taking 
place prior the commencement of 
that change.
text_norm: 3 relevant local authority shall notified location change use taking place prior commencement change

title: to which the following regulations apply would not offend against principles of
heading: 4. ‘international protection’, for
text_raw:
4. ‘international protection’, for 
the purpose of this class, has the 
meaning given to it in section 2(1) 
of the International Protection Act 
2015 (No. 66 of 2015). 

.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 November, 2022. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [605]
